Interface com.penthera.virtuososdk.client.IAssetManager
Inherited members: ShowHide
Deprecated: ShowHide
View: ClientSubclassPackageImplementation
com.penthera.virtuososdk.client

Interface IAssetManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IAssetProvider
    public interface IAssetManager extends IAssetProvider
    Provides access to Cursors over the Asset data. The Asset Manager can be accessed through the getAssetManager call in Virtuoso. As well as providing access to commonly grouped Assets: Queued, Downloaded, Expired and Deferred (those which have not yet been added to the queue), the AssetManager provides the API's to create, manipulate and retrieve single Assets.

    Assets managed by the system must have an external string identifier upon creation in order for the backplane business logic to function. Assets will be assigned an internal numeric ID and a UUID within a device but these are device specific and will not be consistent across devices. The external identifier, referenced as Asset id, provides consistency across the system. Any assets with the same external identifier will be considered duplicates by the backplane, identifiers should be unique to ensure this does not happen unless intended. This is commonly populated using an id associated with the an external asset catalog.

    The Asset Manager's implementation of IAssetProvider defaults to retrieving all Assets know to Virtuoso. The Assets are sorted by their creation time in ascending order. It is possible to issue an update request using the Asset Manager's Uri. The update is restricted to the same fields as the update method:
    1. AssetColumns.METADATA: metadata
    2. AssetColumns.EAP: Expiry after Play
    3. AssetColumns.EAD: Expiry after Download
    4. AssetColumns.START_WINDOW: Start Window
    5. AssetColumns.END_WINDOW: End Window
    6. AssetColumns.CUSTOM_HEADERS: Custom headers
    7. AssetColumns.FIRST_PLAY_TIME: First play time
    Any other field passed in the update request will be ignored.
    See Also:
    AssetColumns

        createFileAsset 
        abstract IFile createFileAsset(java.lang.String aAssetUrl, java.lang.String aAssetId, java.lang.String aMimeType, java.lang.String aMetaData)
        Download a single (non-segmented) file.
        IFile createFileAsset(java.lang.String aAssetUrl, java.lang.String aAssetId, java.lang.String aMimeType, java.lang.String aMetaData)
        Download a single (non-segmented) file.
        Parameters:
        aAssetUrl - Remote URL where the asset (a single file) should be downloaded from
        aAssetId - Caller-provided ID that Virtuoso should assign to the asset, will be considered as unique for business logic rules. See IAssetManager summary for more details.
        aMimeType - Expected mime type. If non-null, Virtuoso will use this value verify the validity of the file mime type during download.
        aMetaData - Metadata that Virtuoso should associate with the asset. Typically a JSON string. Can be null.
        Returns:
        Concrete instance of an IFile implementor, or null if an error occurred.
        See Also:
        IFile

        Same as createHLSSegmentedAssetAsync(HLSAssetBuilder.HLSAssetParams), but not blocking Use HLSAssetBuilder to assemble the parameters for the HLS asset This method is blocking and will throw an runtime exception if called from the UI thread

        createHLSSegmentedAsset 
        abstract ISegmentedAsset createHLSSegmentedAsset(java.net.URL aManifestUrl, int aDesiredBitRate, java.lang.String aAssetId, java.lang.String aMetadata, boolean aDownloadEncryptionkeys, boolean aAddToQueue, IQueue.IQueuedAssetPermissionObserver aPermObserver)
        Deprecated.
        @Deprecated ISegmentedAsset createHLSSegmentedAsset(java.net.URL aManifestUrl, int aDesiredBitRate, java.lang.String aAssetId, java.lang.String aMetadata, boolean aDownloadEncryptionkeys, boolean aAddToQueue, IQueue.IQueuedAssetPermissionObserver aPermObserver)
        Deprecated. 
        Download an HLS video straight from a manifest file. Virtuoso will download and parse the given manifest, select the appropriate profile, and download all the fragments belonging to that profile. This is a blocking operation. If the aAddToQueue parameter is true and aPermObserver is not null then the Permission Observer callback will be called after addition. This method is blocking and will throw an runtime exception if called from the UI thread
        Parameters:
        aManifestUrl - Remote URL of the manifest
        aDesiredBitRate - Virtuoso uses the closest bitrate, which does not exceed this one, when generating from a playlist. A value of 1 means "use the lowest bitrate." If there's no profile of lower bitrate than aDesiredBitRate, Virtuoso will select the lowest bitrate profile. A value of Integer.MAX_VALUE means "use the highest bitrate."
        aAssetId - Caller-provided ID that Virtuoso should assign to the asset, will be considered as unique for business logic rules. See IAssetManager summary for more details.
        aMetadata - Metadata that Virtuoso should associate with the asset. Typically a JSON string. Can be null.
        aDownloadEncryptionkeys - If true, Virtuoso will download all the encryption keys
        aAddToQueue - If true, Virtuoso will automatically add the asset to the download queue.
        aPermObserver - The observer to be notified of any permission checks when added.
        Returns:
        Generated ISegmentedAsset, or null if an error occurred

        createHSSSegmentedAsset 
        abstract ISegmentedAsset createHSSSegmentedAsset(java.net.URL aManifestUrl, int aDesiredVideoBitRate, int aDesiredAudioBitRate, java.lang.String aAssetId, java.lang.String aMetadata, boolean aAddToQueue, IQueue.IQueuedAssetPermissionObserver aPermObserver)
        Deprecated.
        @Deprecated ISegmentedAsset createHSSSegmentedAsset(java.net.URL aManifestUrl, int aDesiredVideoBitRate, int aDesiredAudioBitRate, java.lang.String aAssetId, java.lang.String aMetadata, boolean aAddToQueue, IQueue.IQueuedAssetPermissionObserver aPermObserver)
        Deprecated. 
        Download an HSS video straight from a manifest file. Virtuoso will download and parse the given manifest, select the appropriate profile, and download all the fragments belonging to that profile. This is a blocking operation. If the aAddToQueue parameter is true and aPermObserver is not null then the Permission Observer callback will be called after addition. This method is blocking and will throw an runtime exception if called from the UI thread
        Parameters:
        aManifestUrl - Remote URL of the manifest
        aDesiredVideoBitRate - Virtuoso uses the closest video bitrate, which does not exceed this one, when generating from a playlist. If all available bitrates exceed this value then the lowest bit rate is chosen. The value must be between 1 and Integer.MAX_VALUE.
        aDesiredAudioBitRate - Virtuoso uses the closest audio bitrate, which does not exceed this one, when generating from a playlist. If all availalbe bitrates exceed this value then the lowest bit rate is chosen. The value must be between 1 and Integer.MAX_VALUE.
        aAssetId - Caller-provided ID that Virtuoso should assign to the asset, will be considered as unique for business logic rules. See IAssetManager summary for more details.
        aMetadata - Metadata that Virtuoso should associate with the asset. Typically a JSON string. Can be null.
        aAddToQueue - If true, Virtuoso will automatically add the asset to the download queue.
        aPermObserver - The observer to be notified of any permission checks when added.
        Returns:
        Generated ISegmentedAsset, or null if an error occurred

        createSegmentedAsset 
        abstract ISegmentedAsset createSegmentedAsset(java.lang.String aAssetId, java.lang.String aMetadata)
        Download a segmented video, where you need to manually add segments to the asset later.
        ISegmentedAsset createSegmentedAsset(java.lang.String aAssetId, java.lang.String aMetadata)
        Download a segmented video, where you need to manually add segments to the asset later. This method leaves the newly-created asset instance in an un-queued state, so you can then add segments to it (via ISegmentedAsset.addSegments). Once you've added all segments, you should add the asset to the download queue.
        Parameters:
        aAssetId - Caller-provided ID that Virtuoso should assign to the asset, will be considered as unique for business logic rules. See IAssetManager summary for more details.
        aMetadata - Metadata that Virtuoso should associate with the asset. Typically a JSON string. Can be null.
        Returns:
        Concrete implementation of the ISegmentedAsset interface, or null if an error occurred.
        See Also:
        ISegmentedAsset

        deleteAll 
        abstract void deleteAll()
        Delete all assets, including all queued, deferred, expired and previously-downloaded assets.
        void deleteAll()
        Delete all assets, including all queued, deferred, expired and previously-downloaded assets.
        This a blocking operation.
        No callbacks or notifications occur for this operation. It is synchronous, upon completion all Assets known to the SDK have been removed from the database and any downloaded content deleted from disk.

        getByAssetId 
        abstract java.util.List<IIdentifier> getByAssetId(java.lang.String aAssetId)
        List of assets that match the given Asset ID.
        java.util.List<IIdentifier> getByAssetId(java.lang.String aAssetId)
        List of assets that match the given Asset ID.
        Virtuoso uniquely identifies assets by their integer id but callers may be more familiar with their remote catalog ID. This allows callers to retrieve a list of all assets in Virtuoso using the asset ID. Commonly only returns one item as remote catalog IDs should be unique to the asset.
        Parameters:
        aAssetId - ID of the asset to search for
        Returns:
        List of matching assets
        See Also:
        IAsset
        pauseDownload 
        abstract void pauseDownload(IAsset aAsset)
        Pause an asset from being downloaded.
        void pauseDownload(IAsset aAsset)
        Pause an asset from being downloaded. If the asset is already queued then it will remain in the queue but will not be downloaded. It will not block other items in the queue from downloading. If the download has started then the item will stop downloading but any content already stored will be retained and it will count towards any download limits. If the download is already complete this method will have no effect.
        Parameters:
        aAsset - Asset with updated data
        pauseDownload 
        abstract void pauseDownload(int aId)
        Pause an asset from being downloaded.
        void pauseDownload(int aId)
        Pause an asset from being downloaded. If the asset is already queued then it will remain in the queue but will not be downloaded. It will not block other items in the queue from downloading. If the download has started then the item will stop downloading but any content already stored will be retained and it will count towards any download limits. If the download is already complete this method will have no effect.
        Parameters:
        aId - The id of the Asset to expire
        See Also:
        IIdentifier.getId()

        update 
        abstract boolean update(IAsset aAsset)
        Persists an asset's client data to the internal database.
        boolean update(IAsset aAsset)
        Persists an asset's client data to the internal database.
        This will update the following fields in the asset:
        1. metadata
        2. Expiry after Play
        3. Expiry after Download
        4. Start Window
        5. End Window
        6. Custom headers
        7. First play time
        Parameters:
        aAsset - Asset with updated data
        Returns:
        True if the update was successful and the new data persisted to storage
        See Also:
        IAsset
      • Asset Cursors 
        Modifier and Type Method and Description
        getDeferred 
        abstract IAssetProvider getDeferred()
        Access an interface for querying the list of deferred Assets.
        IAssetProvider getDeferred()
        Access an interface for querying the list of deferred Assets. Deferred Assets are those which have been created but not yet been added to the queue. The interface for deferred assets defaults to sorting the assets by their creation time in ascending order.
        Returns:
        The interface for accessing the deferred assets.
        See Also:
        IAssetProvider
        getDownloaded 
        abstract IAssetProvider getDownloaded()
        Access an interface for querying the list of downloaded Assets.
        IAssetProvider getDownloaded()
        Access an interface for querying the list of downloaded Assets. The interface for downloaded assets defaults to sorting the assets by their completion time in ascending order.
        Returns:
        The interface for accessing the downloaded assets.
        See Also:
        IAssetProvider
        getExpired 
        abstract IAssetProvider getExpired()
        Access an interface for querying the list of expired Assets.
        IAssetProvider getExpired()
        Access an interface for querying the list of expired Assets. The interface for expired assets defaults to sorting the assets by their last modification time in ascending order.
        Returns:
        The interface for accessing the downloaded assets.
        See Also:
        IAssetProvider
        getParserQueue 
        abstract IAssetProvider getParserQueue()
        Access an interface for querying the list of assets which are currently being parsed or queued for parsing.
        IAssetProvider getParserQueue()
        Access an interface for querying the list of assets which are currently being parsed or queued for parsing. The interface for parsing assets defaults to sorting the assets by the order in which they were added.
        Returns:
        The interface for accessing the parsing assets.
        See Also:
        IAssetProvider
        getQueue 
        abstract IQueue getQueue()
        Access the interface for manipulating and querying the Queue.
        IQueue getQueue()
        Access the interface for manipulating and querying the Queue. The Queue defaults to sorting its Cursors and lists of assets by their position in the Queue.
        Returns:
        The interface for accessing the Queue.
        See Also:
        IQueue
      • Other Methods 
        Modifier and Type Method and Description
        addParserObserverForAsset 
        abstract boolean addParserObserverForAsset(ISegmentedAsset asset, ISegmentedAssetFromParserObserver observer)
        Register a parser observer for an asset which is being processed.
        boolean addParserObserverForAsset(ISegmentedAsset asset, ISegmentedAssetFromParserObserver observer)
        Register a parser observer for an asset which is being processed. The observer will then receive all relevant callbacks for that asset. This is only relevant for segmented asset * types which are created and checked asynchronously. The return value indicates if the observer was successfully added, if not then the asset is no longer in a parsing state.
        Parameters:
        asset - The asset to observe
        observer - The parser observer
        Returns:
        true if the observer was added, false if the asset is not in a state where the observer can be added.
        addPermissionsObserverForAsset 
        abstract boolean addPermissionsObserverForAsset(ISegmentedAsset asset, IQueue.IQueuedAssetPermissionObserver observer)
        Register a permission observer for an asset which is being processed.
        boolean addPermissionsObserverForAsset(ISegmentedAsset asset, IQueue.IQueuedAssetPermissionObserver observer)
        Register a permission observer for an asset which is being processed. The observer will then receive all relevant permission callbacks for that asset. This is only relevant for segmented asset types which are created and checked asynchronously. The return value indicates if the observer was successfully added, if not then the asset is no longer in a parsing state.
        Parameters:
        asset - The asset to observe
        observer - The permission observer
        Returns:
        true if the observer was added, false if the asset is not in a state where the observer can be added.
        CONTENT_URI 
        abstract Uri CONTENT_URI()
        The Uri used when querying the Content Provider.
        Uri CONTENT_URI()
        Description copied from interface: IAssetProvider
        The Uri used when querying the Content Provider. This is the Uri used for notifications when content changes.
        Unless otherwise stated this Uri can only be used for querying the Content Provider.
        Returns:
        The Uri

        getCursor 
        abstract Cursor getCursor()
        Queries the Uri, returning a Cursor over the result set.
        Cursor getCursor()
        Description copied from interface: IAssetProvider
        Queries the Uri, returning a Cursor over the result set.
        The Cursor will default to retrieving all fields and all rows from the Content provider. The sorting order on the Cursor is determined by the Asset Provider's implementation.
        Returns:
        A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry, or null.
        getCursor 
        abstract Cursor getCursor(java.lang.String[] projection, java.lang.String selection, java.lang.String[] selectionArgs)
        Queries the Uri, returning a Cursor over the result set.
        Cursor getCursor(java.lang.String[] projection, java.lang.String selection, java.lang.String[] selectionArgs)
        Description copied from interface: IAssetProvider
        Queries the Uri, returning a Cursor over the result set. The sorting order on the Cursor is determined by the Asset Provider's implementation.
        Parameters:
        projection - A list of which columns to return. Passing null will return all columns.
        selection - A filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows.
        selectionArgs - You may include ?s in selection, which will be replaced by the values from selectionArgs, in the order that they appear in the selection. The values will be bound as Strings.
        Returns:
        A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry, or null.
        getCursor 
        abstract Cursor getCursor(java.lang.String[] projection, java.lang.String selection, java.lang.String[] selectionArgs, java.lang.String sort)
        Queries the Uri, returning a Cursor over the result set.
        Cursor getCursor(java.lang.String[] projection, java.lang.String selection, java.lang.String[] selectionArgs, java.lang.String sort)
        Description copied from interface: IAssetProvider
        Queries the Uri, returning a Cursor over the result set.
        Parameters:
        projection - A list of which columns to return. Passing null will return all columns.
        selection - A filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows.
        selectionArgs - You may include ?s in selection, which will be replaced by the values from selectionArgs, in the order that they appear in the selection. The values will be bound as Strings.
        sort - How to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing null will use the default sort order, which may be unordered.
        Returns:
        A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry, or null.
